articles.title: Truebit’s native token TRU plunges 99.9% after $26 million exploit
articles.description: Ethereum-based Truebit suffered a $26.6 million exploit that reportedly targeted a vulnerability in a smart contract deployed five years ago.

articles.title: Optimism floats OP buyback proposal using Superchain revenue
articles.description: A new plan would tie OP token value to network performance by using half of all Superchain fee revenue for systematic repurchases.

articles.title: Global sanctions fuel record flow to illicit crypto addresses
articles.description: The Global Sanctions Inflation Index estimated there were just under 80,000 total sanctioned entities and persons globally as of May 2025.

articles.title: Bitcoin to hit $2.9M by 2050 as it muscles into global trade: VanEck
articles.description: VanEck analysts said Bitcoin could handle 5–10% of global trade and make up 2.5% of central bank reserves by 2050, driving its strategic role as a monetary hedge.

articles.title: Iran’s Internet Traffic Drops to 'Near Zero' as Protests Intensify
articles.description: Cloudflare data shows a near-total blackout as demonstrations calling for regime change spread and authorities tighten control.

articles.title: Trump Rules Out Pardon for FTX Founder Sam Bankman-Fried: NYT
articles.description: Trump was responding to a reporter who also asked about pardon requests for other high-profile figures, including Sean “Diddy” Combs.

articles.title: Bitcoin holds near $91,000 as market awaits Trump tariff ruling: Asia Morning Briefing
articles.description: Prediction markets see low odds of a clear Supreme Court ruling on tariffs, a setup that has previously triggered short-term volatility in bitcoin, which then stabilized.

articles.title: Coinbase lands 2nd ‘buy’ rating in a week, with BofA seeing 38% upside
articles.description: Bank of America has upgraded Coinbase's rating on reversing short interest and tax-loss harvesting, while the exchange is broadening its vision to put the financial system onchain.

articles.title: Revived NY bill targets sports, politics and death prediction markets
articles.description: New York lawmakers will soon review a bill that seeks to ban certain sports and political event contracts in the state, among others.

articles.title: Cathie Wood says US gov’t may ‘start buying’ to stock national bitcoin reserve
articles.description: The founder of ARK Invest said crypto was 'part of the reason [Trump] won the presidency,' and could be a politically salient midterm topic.

articles.title: Wall Street, Crypto Leaders Make 'Progress' on Crypto Bill in Private Meeting: Sources
articles.description: Leaders of a major Wall Street trade group and DeFi-focused crypto leaders are trying to hash out key disagreements before the market structure bill faces a do-or-die Senate vote next week.

articles.title: JPMorgan says crypto de-risking is likely over as ETF flows stabilize
articles.description: The recent crypto market correction was driven mainly by investor de-risking following MSCI’s Oct. announcement, JPMorgan said.

articles.title: Trump says he won't rescue Sam Bankman-Fried with pardon
articles.description: The president told the New York Times he won't pardon ex-FTX CEO SBF, nor will he be granting help to Sean Combs or Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro.

articles.title: CFTC issues no-action relief, clearing Bitnomial to offer event contracts
articles.description: Divisions within the CFTC have given the green light for crypto-focused exchange Bitnomial to offer event contracts.

articles.title: Trump Says He Won’t Pardon Sam Bankman-Fried
articles.description:
Bitcoin Magazine

Trump Says He Won’t Pardon Sam Bankman-Fried
President Donald Trump said he will not pardon former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried, rejecting clemency for the convicted crypto executive.

articles.title: Nexo to offer zero-interest crypto lending for BTC and ETH holders
articles.description: The offering expands Nexo’s structured lending products to Bitcoin and Ether holders amid a broader recovery in crypto-backed lending.

articles.title: Ethereum Treasury Firm SharpLink Stakes $170 Million of ETH on Linea
articles.description: Publicly traded Ethereum treasury firm SharpLink Gaming staked $170 million worth of ETH on Ethereum layer-2 scaling network, Linea.

articles.title: Boston Dynamics Unveils First Commercial Atlas Humanoid Robot
articles.description: Boston Dynamics said manufacturing on its humanoid Atlas robots will begin immediately, with all 2026 deployments already reserved.

articles.title: BofA upgrades Coinbase after pullback, says crypto adoption still in ‘early innings’
articles.description: The bank also pointed to infrastructure revenue, including Base and derivatives, as emerging buffers against trading volatility.

articles.title: CFTC issues no-action letter to Bitnomial, clearing way for event contracts
articles.description: The no-action letter comes amid growing acceptance by US regulators of prediction-style markets and event contracts during an election year.

articles.title: Bitnomial wins U.S. regulator's nod on prediction markets push, joins growing crowd
articles.description: U.S. derivatives platform and clearinghouse is focusing on prediction contracts targeted at digital assets movements and economic indicators.

articles.title: Donald Trump will not consider pardon for Sam Bankman-Fried: NYT
articles.description: The US president reportedly said he had no intention of pardoning the former FTX CEO, and defended his family’s connections to the crypto industry.

articles.title: Trump says he has no plans to pardon jailed FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried: NYT
articles.description: President Donald Trump told The New York Times that he has no plans to pardon former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried.

articles.title: Myriad Moves: Traders Bet on Zcash Rebound, But Aren't Buying Another Bitcoin All-Time High
articles.description: Top markets on Myriad this week include predictions on a new Bitcoin all-time high, Ethereum’s next move, and whether Zcash will bounce back.

articles.description: Bitcoin bulls are making a run on $91,000 as start-of-the-year trading volumes highlight the market’s expectation of a positive Q1.

articles.title: Scientists Crammed a Computer Into a Robot the Size of a Grain of Salt
articles.description: Researchers built autonomous robots the size of salt grains—with onboard computers, sensors, and motors that think and swim independently for months.

articles.title: Truebit token price falls 99% after reports of $26M exploit
articles.description: The TRU price fell to $0.0000000029 from $0.16  after the protocol reported a security incident and crypto sleuths tracked stolen Ether.

articles.title: Temple Digital Group launches 24/7 institutional trading built on Canton
articles.description: The platform offers a private, non-custodial venue for regulated institutions to trade cryptocurrencies and stablecoins.

articles.title: New York Lawmakers Target Prediction Markets as NHL's Rangers Ink Polymarket Deal
articles.description: A New York assemblyman reintroduced a bill that would restrict prediction markets, barring bets on individual sports matches, war, and more.

articles.title: Bank of America upgrades Coinbase to 'buy' as exchange moves beyond crypto
articles.description: Bank of America said it recommended investors buy Coinbase's stock, pointing to its new products including weekday equities trading and prediction markets.

articles.title: Florida becomes latest state to pursue bitcoin reserve ahead of 2026 session
articles.description: The bill walls off bitcoin holdings in a standalone reserve, avoiding direct exposure across pensions and other state funds.

articles.title: Morgan Stanley to launch digital asset wallet as part of crypto product expansion
articles.description: The wallet, expected to launch this year, will support cryptocurrencies and RWAs as the financial services company adds to its suite of crypto investment products.

articles.title: Senate crypto bill nears ‘do-or-die’ moment as stablecoins and Trump issues threaten progress, essential votes
articles.description: Senators are sifting through key issues that are proving to be vital in advancing a sweeping crypto bill ahead of next week's votes.

articles.title: Morgan Stanley continues crypto push, plans wallet in the second half of 2026
articles.description: Morgan Stanley's head of wealth management told Barron's the firm plans to launch a proprietary digital wallet later this year.

articles.title: Cryptographers who mass exited Electric Coin Company debut new Zcash wallet

articles.title: ‘Deeply undervalued’ bitcoin faces continued bear market with no clear upside catalyst
articles.description: Experts say the next major rally may come only when long-term holders are exhausted, and true institutional capital enters the market.

articles.title: Crypto Market Cools as Bitcoin Stays Within Death Cross: Analysis
articles.description: The post-New Year rally fizzled fast. Bitcoin is back in death cross territory, and the charts aren't giving bulls much to celebrate.

articles.title: Ethereum scaling network Polygon close to buying bitcoin kiosk firm Coinme, sources say
articles.description: Polygon is paying $100 million to $125 million for the bitcoin ATM provider, according to one of the sources.

articles.description: Florida lawmakers introduced another bill for the creation of a strategic Bitcoin reserve, less than a year after two attempts were shelved.

articles.title: Coincheck to acquire digital asset manager 3iQ in $112M stock deal

articles.title: BlackRock adds $900M BTC as Bitcoin long-term selling falls to 2017 lows
articles.description: BlackRock added close to 9,000 BTC during the first week of January, rebuilding exposure after an end-of-year drawdown in 2025 and pointing to early signs of BTC accumulation.
